title: Generative AI Start-ups Show Interest in Amplitude, a Potential Winner in the AI Industry
originSummary: Amplitude, a cloud software company, is gaining attention from generative AI start-ups due to its technology offerings.
Amplitude specializes in analyzing customer usage of digital products and enhancing the user experience for companies.
Despite facing challenges related to macro factors, Amplitude has the opportunity to capitalize on the growth of the artificial intelligence industry.

title: Apple's Potential Monetization of Generative AI: Analysts Predict Success in Edge AI Space
originSummary: Apple is expected to focus on generative AI in 2024, which could be a significant year for Edge AI.
Apple's unique data, user base, and hardware/software integration could position it as a key player in the race for Edge AI.

Generative AI is expected to boost monetization of Apple's products and increase the long-term value of its user base, with potential revenue-generating paths including hardware share gains, higher pricing in services, commissions from generative AI apps, and a potential premium Siri subscription service.

title: JPMorgan Unveils Programmable Payments on its Onyx Blockchain Platform
originSummary: JPMorgan is rolling out programmable payments on its Onyx blockchain platform.
This feature enables businesses to personalize and automate payment processes for increased efficiency and security.
JPMorgan's goal is to bring about a transformation in the global payments industry through this innovative technology.

title: Harnessing the Power of AI Startups to Address Environmental and Social Challenges
originSummary: AI startups are using technology to tackle environmental and social problems by creating innovative solutions.
These startups are utilizing AI to enhance energy efficiency, decrease carbon emissions, improve agricultural methods, promote sustainability, and address various social and environmental challenges.
Their initiatives also focus on increasing access to education and healthcare, contributing to a positive impact on the world.

title: Unlock Your Potential with Gen AI: The Power of Generative Artificial Intelligence
originSummary: Gen AI, also known as generative AI, is an advanced form of accessible artificial intelligence that aims to enhance user intelligence and productivity.
It allows users to access and generate various types of content, including text, audio, images, videos, and code.
Popular Gen AI applications like ChatGPT and image generators have gained traction in the software industry, but they are not yet widely known among the general public.
Gen AI works by utilizing models trained on large datasets to predict the next word or pixel based on a given input.
While these AI tools can be useful for personal and professional purposes, users should carefully review the generated outputs due to the possibility of inaccuracies.
Despite its limitations, Gen AI has the potential to unlock a new era of human innovation and creativity.

title: Samsung AI Forum 2023: Exploring the Future of Generative AI with Samsung Gauss
originSummary: The second day of the Samsung AI Forum 2023 centered around generative AI and featured presentations from AI experts.
Samsung showcased Samsung Gauss, a generative AI model developed by their research team, which has language, code, and image generation capabilities.

The model is currently being used for employee productivity but will be incorporated into different Samsung products in the future. Samsung also highlighted their commitment to AI safety through the AI Red Team, which focuses on security and privacy concerns.

title: China Proposes New Regulations for Generative AI to Ensure Data Security and Evaluation
originSummary: China's National Information Security Standardization Committee has introduced new regulations for generative AI, emphasizing data security and evaluation.

The regulations mandate that AI developers assess the data sources used to train their models and prohibit the use of blacklisted sources containing violent, terrorist, or content contradicting socialist values.

AI developers will be required to submit a security report and obtain individuals' consent for the use of biometric data before launching their products, reflecting China's cautious approach to emerging technologies.

title: Air India Introduces AI-powered Virtual Assistant to Answer Customer Queries
originSummary: Air India has launched a virtual assistant called Maharaja, powered by AI, to handle customer queries and ease the burden on call center staff.
Maharaja is capable of answering over 6,000 questions daily and communicates with customers through chat interactions.
The virtual assistant was developed in partnership with Microsoft, utilizing Azure OpenAI service and supports four languages for enhanced customer support.
